result.execSummary:
The defendant Ilza Y Lopez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes:
AS TO BOTH COUNTS: Pay all costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Cash bail applied.
- Court sets restitution at $0 (zero).

PROBATION OF CONDITIONS AS TO BOTH COUNTS:
- No condition time ordered.
- Attend and successfully complete an Anger Management program.
- Comply with any treatment or programming ordered by probation.
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Absolute Sobriety.
- No Contact with the victim without the approval of the Court or probation agent.
- Seek/maintain employment.

records.addlTxt:
Letters/correspondence submitted to the Court by defense counsel.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense counsel and defendant as to sentencing.

As to Count 1:
Court ordered defendant to serve 4 MONTHS in the House of Correction concurrent to any other sentence; credit for Zero days served.

As to Count 3:
Court ordered defendant to serve 60 DAYS in the House of Correction concurrent to the sentence imposed as to Count 1; credit for Zero days served.

As to both counts:
Court STAYED the sentence and placed defendant on probation for 12 MONTHS with the following conditions:
- No condition time ordered.
- Attend and successfully complete an Anger Management program
- Comply with any treatment or programming ordered by probation
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Absolute Sobriety
- Court sets Restitution at $0 (zero)
- No contact with the victim without the approval of the Court or probation agent
- Seek/maintain employment.
- Pay all costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
- No contact with firearms

Received and filed:  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.

Defendant Ilza Y Lopez in court with Attorney Jonathan Carver Smith.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

As to Count 1 and Count 3:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY as to both counts.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the Defendant guilty and enters judgment of conviction into the record forthwith. 

As to Count 2:
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on State's motion, Court orders Count 2 DISMISSED but read-in as to sentencing.

Parties are prepared to proceed to sentencing.

Defendant Ilza Y Lopez in court with attorney Jonathan Carver Smith.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case adjourned to 10-7-2015 for plea/sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 7, 2015 at 08:15 am.
The court will modify NCO to NO VIOLENT CONTACT as to Julirose M.

Defendant Ilza Y Lopez in court with attorney Jonathan Carver Smith.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense is requesting another pretrial date.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 2, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Court ordered no possession or use of any dangerous weapons or firearms.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Govanny M.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Ilza Y Lopez in court.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.  Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. 
Defendant was given a referral to the Public Defender's Office. Defendant MAY be Public Defender eligible. The case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Br. *.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 19, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 8/5/15 @ 1:30 pm
